title: Design of Diagnostic and Assessment Tools for Calculus Foundational Competencies for Engineering Students

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Workshop for developing assessment tools to evaluate calculus readiness among engineering freshmen. Establishes a diagnostic evaluation system covering geometry (straight lines, circles, surface area/volume calculations of 3D shapes) and algebra/trigonometry domains

learning_goals: Development of 20 assessment items evaluating core geometric concepts (straight lines, circles, and solid figure calculations) necessary for engineering calculus

Learners perform Item Response Theory (IRT) analysis on medium-difficulty and high-discriminatory items (≥10 items) using SPSS/R over 2–4 weeks and write a validation report meeting the item-fit index (Infit/MnSq) range of 0.7–1.3.
Protocol Design for Validation of Diagnostic Assessment Tools in Algebra and Trigonometry Domains
Guidelines for establishing a customized learning roadmap reflecting measurement tool results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
